text: A spherical black monolith rises up from a white surface. white like the moon.
In the darkness, the towers metal skin is barely visible.
We ROTATE AROUND, revealing the tower to actually be a LA not rising up from a surface, but hanging down from a whi ceiling. The bulb unlit.
Directly below the lamp is the very definition of innocen a sleeping child. Chest rising and falling with each brea
We HOVER over the young boy...watching him. A blanket emblazoned with dinosaurs is draped across his limbs. His mouth is slack, eyelids twitching to dreams unseen.
The truly deep sleep that an adult can only wish for.
We move away from him, exploring the dark room. Strewn wi toys. The door is slightly ajar. We float through it into
--a long hallway. Even darker than the bedroom. And witho the boys rhythmic breathing, even quieter.
A window at the end of the hall enlarges as we approach.
Someone is standing in front of it.
The murky silhouette of the figure turns and walks away. follow it, tentative. Turning a corner, we see the figure Standing in a doorway.
Now we can make out the edges of the person. It is an old woman. Hair in a Victorian bun. A corseted dress.
She stares at us.
Let me in.
OPENING TITLES play out to the shrill screams of George Crumb's `Black Angels I: Night Of The Electric Insects'. 3.
Eyes flick open.
A woman blinks awake, gazing around the room. Another bedroom. Sparse. Just a bed and a cabinet. It is 5.43 AM.
Her eyes settle on the man lying next to her in the dark. heaving snores have woken her up.
She is RENAI (pronounced Renee) LAMBERT (36). With a quie determination she is holding on to her youthful good look but the lines of age are creeping in.
She has settled into the `comfort' years of a marriage: h pinned up messily, wearing dowdy pajamas.
She beholds her husband, taking him in. Considering him. snorts and smacks his lips. Very unflattering.
She climbs out of bed.
High ceilings. Exposed beams. Spanish style windows.
Renai treads across wooden floorboards into a sunken livi room. No matter careful she is, there is a loud creak wit each step. A GRANDFATHER CLOCK in the corner ticks steadi
There is barely any furniture in here, only a BOOKCASE an PIANO. What there is a lot of...is boxes. Large moving bo
Renai plops cross-legged onto the floor and rips open one the boxes, marked BOOKS. She plucks out a handful of book and lines them up on the bookshelf. Then another handful.
They are all self-help and self-improvement books. Titles like `Be The Better You' and `Inch By Inch, It's A Cinch: Guide To Achieving Your Goals' pop out.
She spots a sealed box labelled PHOTO ALBUMS. She strips the tape and wrestles out a dusty album of wedding photos
Smiling faces greet her as she thumbs through the pages. happy couple. Young. Glowing. Sadness washes over her.
Mom?
She snaps out of it and turns to see DALTON LAMBERT (8). son. He approaches her, rubbing his eyes. (It is not the we saw in the opening scene.) 4.
What are you doing up, kiddo?
I don't like my room.
You'll get used to it. It's only your first night.
He climbs into her lap. She bites on his ear playfully.
Argh, I'm going to eat you.
What are you looking at?
Just some photos.
What photos?
She hefts another album from the box, prying it open. A p of a grinning young girl greets them, hair in pigtails.
Do you know who that is?
No.
That's me.
It doesn't look like you.
I know. I'm so happy there. But it's me. When I was your age. I was a kid once too, you know.
No, you weren't.
Renai bursts out laughing. She is famous for her big laug
Thanks. Maybe you're right...I don't remember being this person at all. I hope she smiled like that all the time, whoever she was. 5.
She sizes up her son. The living embodiment of the photo.
This is a terrible thing to admit, Dalton, but sometimes I get jealous of you. That you're so young. That you haven't made any of your decisions yet.
I don't wanna grow old.
Well, it starts happening to us from the moment we're born.
She points to the hands on the grandfather clock.
Every time that clock ticks, we all get a little bit older.
She turns the page in the photo album, seeing an old man.
That's your grandpa. You wouldn't remember him.
He smells like smoke.
Yeah...good memory. He did smoke that god awful pipe, didn't he?
Show me a picture of dad when he was a little kid.
I don't even know if we have any. He's hopeless with keeping photos.
Show me a picture of me when I was a little kid.

Your pictures are all in the computer. Nobody keeps photo albums like this anymore, they're ancient relics. They should. I like being able to touch something, instead of it floating around in cyber world. If the laptop breaks, your whole existence is erased. 6.
What was I like when I was a little kid?
You are a little kid.
She kisses him on the forehead and stares into his eyes.
If only you knew what I know.
We hear a baby crying off screen.
You certainly didn't cry as much as your little sister does. Come on.
Chaos.
Boxes of dinnerware have not been unpacked yet and it is turning the usual morning routine into a nightmare.
Renai is on the phone as her kids buzz around a kitchen i at top speed, creating a high-energy, manic pace in the r
Billing department.
Her son FOSTER (6), tugs on her leg, holding a box of cer
I need a bowl, mom.
Renai rips open a box, rifling through newspaper, phone wedged against her shoulder. She holds out a cup, fluster
Billing department.
It's too small.
Make it work.
Speak to an agent. Speak to an agent. Speak to an agent.
Foster slumps on the floor, pouring cereal and overflowin into the cup. A baby girl in a high chair, CALI (2), sque 7.
JOSH LAMBERT (37) gapes into the mirror, face covered in soap.
He washes it off. Now he's awake we see that he is a hand clean-cut guy - a former high school nerd who got revenge growing into his body.
He sorts through a box labelled JOSH'S BATHROOM STUFF.
He takes out two bottles - TONER and MOISTURIZER. He dabs toner on, then smooths the moisturizer into his forehead around his eyes.
He suddenly notices a grey hair. Looks mortified.
(Michael Corleone voice) Every time I think I've pulled you out...you grow back in.
He plucks it out, wincing melodramatically.
Ouch!
Josh strides in, tie hanging open around his neck. Renai still on the phone. Josh points to his tie.
Well, I'd like to keep the old number if I could.
You really need to learn how to do this, honey.
She threads the tie into a knot for him.
Don't eat on the floor, buddy.
Foster stays where he is, slurping cereal from the cup. Dalton is playing a handheld videogame. Intensely focused
Okay, well, please let me know by the end of today, I have to give the number out. Thank you. 8.
She hangs up, pissed.
Foster, get up. Now.
Foster frowns and obeys.
How come you were up so early? Was Cali crying?
You woke me up.
What do you mean?
You were snoring.
No I wasn't.
Yes you were.
I don't snore.
Yes you do.
My father snored. I do not snore.
How would you know what you do? You're asleep.
Renai marches out of the room. Dalton's game unit beeps loudly and he pumps his fist.
Yes! I made it to the last level! Invisiworld!
Ever amiable, Josh high five's his son.
Good one, champ.
I don't snore, do I? 9.
Renai sees that all the books she unpacked earlier are no scattered across the floor of the living room.
Where are my bleeping pills?
Renai charges in. Josh snatches an apple out of a fruit b biting into it. He quickly gags and spits it out into the
What the heck is this? Wax?!
Yes.
Let me get this straight - we have no actual fruit but we have wax fruit?
Yes.
That is dangerous. It could kill one of our kids.
Where are my pills, Josh?
Probably where you left them, Renai.
She finds them on the counter, snatching them up.
See.
That's not where I left them.
Mom, I need my lunch.
Oh, geez. Look, just...take last night's dinner. 10.
She opens the fridge. It is bare except for a box of sush
Sushi? Aw, that's weirdo food.
It's all we have. Just for today, honey.
Check it first, Dalton. It's probably made out of Styrofoam.
And while I've got you, if you're going to look at my books, please don't leave them all over the floor.
I didn't touch your books.
Josh streaks past, kissing Renai on the cheek.
I gotta go.
Are you taking the boys to school?
No time.
Well can you pick them up after school?
Not today.
But I have stuff I wanted to...
She trails off. He's gone. Foster BURPS. Loudly.
Can I have another cup, mom?
Noisy students settle into their desks. Inner city kids, mostly Hispanic. 11.
Josh is their teacher, scribbling on the blackboard. One student, a lanky boy, ALANSO (16), hovers near the door.
Alanso, please sit down.
No entiendo.
SiГ©ntate, por favor.
Alanso takes a seat. Josh is having trouble getting contr
Come on guys, quieten down.
A pretty girl in the front, TERI, is annoyed at the class
You better all shut up.
She commands respect. They do. Except for one kid.
Just cos you're in love.
Thank you, Teri. Today we are going to talk about Darwin. It's a city in Australia, but it's also the last name of which famous naturalist?
Charles Darwin.
Correct. Does anybody know what he is famous for?
He said that people descended from monkeys.
Half right. He wrote a seminal book that explained his theories on natural selection, and how the different species on this planet - including humans - evolved.
I know I didn't evolve from no monkey. Shit. 12.
Everyone laughs.
Humans actually have a lot in common with monkeys, or more specifically, chimpanzees.
Maybe you do, but I was created in the image of my Dios.
He takes a gold cross hanging on a necklace out of his sh kissing it and holding it up. That gets another laugh.
I respect your right to believe that, Alanso. But I want to give you all possible theories. I want this class to go out into the world with an informed opinion.
The theory is incorrect, Mr. Lambert.
How can it be incorrect? It's a theory. A scientific theory.
Yeah, well, science is bullshit. We didn't get here cos of no test-tubes.
Alanso, if you keep talking like that I'm going to ask you to visit the principal.
Fine.
He gets up and leaves as the class JEERS and BOOS.
Peace and quiet at last.
Renai gropes in behind the bookcase, plucking a hidden je box free. She pinches a cigarette out of it and lights it
She sits down at her piano, feeling the keys, warming her fingers up. Sunlight streams in through the windows.
She takes out a notebook, filled with scribbled handwriti 13.
She places the notebook on the sheetstand, then sets a sm mechanical METRONOME in motion and begins tapping out a s melody in time with it.
Yeah, I'm looking west, always been looking that way, gonna get it all happening, just can't do it today...
She stops and makes a note in her book. She starts over, rising to the emotion of the song. She's got a good voice
Yeah, I'm looking west, always been looking that way, I'm gonna be somebody, I just can't be her today--
She is interrupted by the tinny sound of a baby crying.
She stops playing and looks over at a baby monitor, the source of the noise.
Renai deflates, her shoulders sagging in defeat. She clos her notebook and leaves the room.
Renai scoops up Cali, rocking her gently.
A scratching sound interrupts. Rough. Frantic. Like a dog pawing at something.
Renai steps into the hall, curious. She can still hear it She follows the sound to a door. Grabs the door handle.
The sound abruptly ceases.
The door whines open and stabs a blade of light onto a se stairs that descend into a gloomy basement.
Renai stands at the top of the stairs, squinting into the inky blackness, straining to see.
She reaches up and yanks a light chain, illuminating a ba bulb and throwing light across the tenebrous space. 14.
The basement is large and completely bare. Cleaned out.
Renai takes a step down. She is still carrying Cali.
FURTHER DOWN below her, we see that there is one step tha cracked and broken.
She takes another step. The broken step is right below he
One more step and she will fall.
Cali squeals happily. Renai pauses...then turns around, heading back up the stairs. Stops when she sees something
DEEP, VIOLENT SCRATCH MARKS...running downwards on the in of the door...as if someone were trying to claw their way
A Spanish-style home. Very pretty. This is not the suburb More of an inner city neighborhood. There's history here.
Josh pulls into the driveway of his new house in his Suba
The house almost looks liveable.
Foster is watching loud, zany cartoons on TV. Cali is in high chair. Renai is folding boxes. She has unpacked most the living room and is very tired.
Josh ambles in, sees the work Renai has done.
Look at this. Nice job.
Foster bolts over and crashes into his dads legs, hugging
Whoa, buddy. Slow down.
Josh, where's the box of my lamps?
I don't know. They should be here. We packed them up.
Yeah, I packed them. They're not here. 15.
I remember the movers bringing them in and putting them right there.
Well, they're not here. I would know, I've been unpacking this stuff all day.
Dalton wanders the hall, sporting a red superhero CAPE an carrying a plastic, glowing light-sabre toy.
He reaches a door. The basement door. He pulls it open.
Dalton holds up his light-sabre, the glow allowing him to make out the murky corners of the basement below.
He takes a step down the stairs. Then another step.
The broken step is right below him.
He steps again --
-- and falls. Flails forward, tumbling down the steps, al the way to the bottom. His light sabre SHATTERS.
He hits the ground, his head smacking the floor.
All is dark.
Josh sits with Foster, zoned out in front of the droning
Pitch black.
Dazed, Dalton sits up. His head is cut and bleeding. He i alone in the dark. He stares into the corner of the surrounding cell.
His eyes adjust, making out a shape.
A shadow. 16.
Josh and Renai look up as the quiet is shattered by a SCR
They spring into action, scrambling to their feet.
Dalton? Where are you?
He doesn't answer. Just keeps screaming.
Renai and Josh whip the door open, glaring into the basem from the top of the stairs.
Dalton?
Dalton is crumpled at the bottom of the steps, sobbing, h red cape gathered around him.
Renai flicks the light on. Her and Josh scamper down the steps, propping Dalton up.
What happened?
I fell.
Dalton, you have to be careful. You shouldn't be coming down here in the dark.
Where do you hurt the most?
My knee and my head. I can't stand up.
Josh lifts him to his feet. A severely grazed knee is dot with blood. He's okay.
You scared us, champ.
Josh carries him up the stairs as he sucks in sobs.
Renai glances around the basement, her eyes landing on th lone object that resides in it. 17.
She frowns. It wasn't there when she saw the basement las
It is a box. One of her large, cardboard moving boxes.
It is marked LAMPS.
Dalton is lying in bed, a band-aid slapped across his forehead. Renai tucks him in, Josh standing over him.
You're lucky you don't need stitches.
If I catch you falling down the stairs again I'm gonna break your neck.
That doesn't make sense.
There are dozens of pictures tacked to the wall, all draw Dalton. Josh taps one; a drawing of Dalton flying through night sky, wearing his cape.
You might be a superhero but you're not invincible. Be more careful, bud.
Renai kisses him and gets up.
Sleep tight, honey.
They wave goodbye and turn out the light.
Renai flops into bed beside Josh, exhausted.
We've gotta lock that door.
He's such a boy. He goes off exploring. Sometimes I wanna keep him on one of those child leashes.
Why bother with a child leash? I'll stop at the pet store tomorrow. 18.
She laughs and cuddles up to him, resting her head on his
I'm sorry I was pissy when you got home. I was trying to work on a song today and then Cali woke up and wouldn't stop crying...
I didn't even notice.
I feel guilty for wanting my own time.
It's normal to want your own time.
Is it? My mother gave up everything for me. I keep waiting for the completely selfless parent gene to kick in, but I'm exactly the same person I was when I was 22, only now I'm married with kids.
You're a great mother.
No, I'm not. They like you so much better than me.
That's not true.
You're the cool dad who comes home with presents and I'm the one who yells at them all day.
Now you're being crazy. They love you. At least you get to connect with them. I work so much.
Believe me, you're their hero. They try to play us off against each other. They're master manipulators. I guess they really are my kids.
Josh laughs. A lull settles over them. 19.
Is this it, Josh?
Is this so bad?
She doesn't answer. They sit in silence for a long beat.
Thank you for letting me take some time off to work on my music again.
We'll get by. I want you to do it.
There's a couple of songs...I mean not all of them, but there's a couple of them that I think are really good. And I think, maybe I could do something with them.
I love all your songs.
They kiss.
It is 3AM. All the remoteness of that hour is present here...we can feel it.
As still and quiet as deep space.
The formerly bustling kitchen is now a museum at midnight
A long, dark thoroughfare. A ticking clock its only occup
Stairs swallowed up by darkness. The groan of settling wo
The soft breathing of a sleeping child. 20.
Hanging toy birds dangle over the baby, tinkling in a bre
Dalton is sleeping too. Impossibly still. Lying on his ba
Renai and Josh are entwined together. Josh is snoring. Th are both blissfully asleep...
...for now.
Another day, another chaotic breakfast.
Foster waves a stuffed toy around. Josh charges in, bits tissue on his face from shaving cuts. Cali flails her arm her high chair. Renai is at the sink, whisking eggs.
Foster, sit down honey.
She whips a look around.
Where is...? Hey Josh, could you go wake up Dalton?
We FOLLOW Josh as he marches down the corridor to Dalton' bedroom, poking his head inside.
Josh knocks on the wall.
Time to get up, my man. Come on.
Nothing from Dalton. He doesn't even stir. Josh rolls his eyes and walks in. Nudges Dalton with his knee.
You're making me look bad here. Outta bed before your mother comes in and kills both of us. 21.
Nothing. He's really out.
Josh reaches down and shakes Dalton vigorously.
Dalton, get up. You've gotta get ready for school.
Josh waits for a response, but none comes. Dalton is as s as a puppet. Something resembling concern crosses Josh's
Dalton...?
He kneels down, shaking Dalton hard. He listens for breat
Dalton? Dalton?! DALTON!!
His scream takes us into--
--the stern sterility of a hospital.
Josh and Renai, eyes lined by dark circles, stand in fron a dour neurologist, DR. JOEL SERCARZ (46).
Renai dabs her eyes with a tissue. They are red with tear Beyond a window in front of them, lying on a gurney in an chamber, is the unconscious body of Dalton.

Okay...as of yet, our tests have not drawn any conclusive answers for you. Repeated blood and CSF cultures are normal, making an infective origin highly unlikely. Tests for Lyme disease and repeated polymerase chain reaction are negative. Systemic vasculitis was ruled out. Dalton remains in an areactive coma without focal signs or abnormal brainstem reflexes.
Josh and Renai struggle to follow the cold, multi-syllabl medical terminology...like stranded tourists keeping up w a foreign language.
We've looked for bacterial pathogens like Meningoencephalitis, but haven't seen anything.
I wouldn't say we've exhausted every single angle...but we're close. The underlying cause is still unknown.
Josh and Renai look in at their boy.
The good news is that he's breathing without the use of a mechanical apparatus, and there are no lesions or hemorrhages in any of the CT scans.
So...there's no brain damage or...?

None that we've detected. Technically, he's in a coma. He doesn't respond to stimuli, he has no sleep-wake cycle, but there's no brain trauma or infection. His scans are normal. To be honest, I've never seen anything like it.
That fall he took...I mean, it looked like he hit his head pretty hard.
We definitely exhausted that possibility, but it was always doubtful. The cut was superficial, there wasn't even a skull fracture.
He can't just not wake up...there's got to be something...
Renai sobs, tears streaming down her face. Josh looks lik deer in the headlights. Stunned dumb.
Sercarz clears his throat. This part of the job isn't his specialty.
I'm sorry.
So what do we do now? Does he stay here?
We'll conduct some further testing, but beyond that...I really don't know. 23.
His pager goes off. He checks it.
Excuse me for a minute. I have to step out. A nurse will be with you in just a moment.
He leaves quickly. Josh and Renai press on the glass, separated in body and spirit from their son.
A ghastly meld of hospital room and young boys bedroom.
Dalton lies on his bed, a heart rate monitor hooked to hi chest. IV tubes run into his arms, a Nasogastric feeding into his mouth.
A young nurse, ADELE CHALFIN (30), checks the various tub as Renai watches on.
Are you having any more trouble with the feeding tube?
Renai looks broken, the life drained from her. A wilted f She shakes her head, her voice a low rasp.
It's okay.
Alright, well I'll be back soon. I'll bring some new books. You're probably sick of the ones you have.
Did he respond to any of the tests?
Adele pauses.
No...no, he didn't. But we have to give it time. I've seen coma patients with a much longer inactivity time suddenly start making noises. 24.
He's not in a coma, remember? They don't know what to call it. They don't know what to do with him so they've given up.
No, they haven't. We're going to figure it out.
Adele hugs her, then exits. Renai slumps down on a chair to her son.
The heart rate monitor pings. Dalton is as still as a sta
Renai shuffles down the corridor. She passes a bedroom do then stops and doubles back, pushing it open and going in
--the babies room.
She stares into the crib...at her other sleeping baby. Sh sets the baby monitor and walks out softly.
Renai slumps in front of her piano. Taps one of the keys.
She plays a discordant melody of low notes with one hand, present enough to hear it.
She stops and buries her face in her hands.
Then she hears it. Whispering.
It's so low you would miss it if the house wasn't absolut silent. Renai looks up, scanning for the source of the mu
It is coming from the baby monitor.
Confused, Renai picks up the monitor, turning up the volu all the way up. The hissssssss of static fills the room.
She presses her ear to the device, then hears it again - hushed WHISPER, almost indistinct from the static save fo the whistle of sibilants. 25.
They see us...all of us...we have to be quick...this life begs us to come back.
The whisper trails off....more static...
Renai drops the baby monitor, leaping out of her skin at sound of the scream. Nerves fried.
The monitor smashes on the floor. All is quiet.
Renai moves to the door, staring down the corridor at the door to Cali's nursery.
It is open only a crack. She hears crying. Cali is crying
We follow her as she bolts towards the nursery, smashing through the door, eyes filled with terror, seeing--
--nothing.
Renai stalks into the room.
The room is empty, save for Cali, crying in her crib. Ren eyes land on the closet.
Through a slight crack, we see Renai approach. Breath quivering. Her hand reaches out. She FLINGS the door open
It is empty.
The family is eating. It's very quiet.
Foster keeps his eyes down as his parents eat in silence. Suddenly Cali breaks the quiet, squealing happily.
Dadda!
Josh looks up, smiling. Amazed. 26.
She said dad...
Neither Renai nor Foster even look up.
A bedside lamp gives off a jaundice glow.
Renai gathers up scattered toys from the floor, relocatin them to a desktop covered in beakers and lab equipment.
Foster lies in bed beneath a large chart of the solar sys
Renai stops cleaning when she finds a certificate, crumpl next to a school bag. It says IN RECOGNITION OF SCIENCE SKILL, AWARDED TO FOSTER LAMBERT ON 3/14/10.
What's this?
An award.
That's today's date. You got this today?
Foster nods meekly.
Why didn't you tell us, honey?
She sits on the edge of his bed. He stares at the wall. S strokes his hair.
I know it's hard right now. But things will get better. I promise.
Foster nods.
I'm going to show this to your dad.
She plants a kiss his forehead and stands up.
I'm scared, mom.
Scared of what? 27.
Dalton.
Renai sits back down.
We're all scared. It's normal to be scared for him. But we can't give up--
Why do I have to sleep so close to him? Can't I change rooms?
Why would you wanna change rooms?
Foster swallows.
I don't know.
Renai stares at her son. She kisses him again.
Your brother needs you. Goodnight honey.
Josh lies in bed, reading Foster's award. Renai is beside
Something happened today. I didn't want to tell you in front of Foster.
What?
I heard something coming from Cali's room. A man's voice. On the baby monitor...it scared the hell outta me. I went in there and no one was there.
Could it have been interference?
I don't know. It was so clear. I was sitting at the piano and I heard this...whispering on the baby monitor. So I held my ear up to it-- 28.
SUDDENLY - a noise interrupts. An arrhythmic KNOCKING sou like a drunk pounding on a tavern door after closing.
It is the front door.
Who the hell is that?
Josh knows it's his job to check, but he doesn't want to.
Stay here.
He gets up.
Josh approaches the front door, flashlight in hand. He pe through curtains at the front step.
It's too dark to see anything.
Hello? Who's there?
Only the wind replies.
He aims the flashlight at the glass, shining it into the thick darkness. There is no one on the front step.
Josh presses the flashlight against the window, arcing th beam across his front garden. Leans in close to the glass
Nothing. There's no one there.
He makes sure the door is locked, then flips open a secur system panel on the wall, pecking at the buttons on it.
Renai sits up in bed, listening. Hears nothing...
...until the low moans of a baby crying float out of the monitor. Renai hurls the sheet aside.
Renai pads down the hall, tentative. 29.
She reaches the open door to Cali's room. Sees the silhou of Josh standing over Cali's crib. Exhales with relief.
Who was it, Josh?
Josh appears at the opposite end of the hallway.
What did you say?
Renai SCREAMS as the silhouette recedes into the shadows.
There's someone in there!
She RUNS towards Josh.
There's someone in Cali's room!
Josh BOLTS down the hall, flicking on the light, terrifie
The nursery is empty. Cali is sleeping. Terrified, Josh enters the room. Scans around. Only toys and colorful wallpaper.
He steps in further. He's not cut out for this.
The house alarm screams to deafening life, shaving a few years off Josh's life in the process. He JOLTS, whipping around.
Grab Cali and Foster!
Josh charges down the hall into the--
--snatching up a fire poker from the fireplace and contin
-- to the front door, which is swinging open. Holding the fire poker aloft, Josh scans the area.
Renai races past, carrying Cali and dragging Foster behin her. They barrel toward Dalton's room. 30.
Josh scans the kitchen. It is empty.
The alarm wails in the background.
Josh inches his way up the hall, hand shaking.
Renai holds Foster and Cali close to her. Dalton is lying behind them.
Directly across from Dalton's room is the laundry. The do is ajar, offering a view into the darkened room beyond.
Renai sees something in the dark...a figure. A boy.
It looks like Dalton. He reaches out to Renai--
--until another HAND...a pale hand...reaches across and s the laundry door, sealing the boy off from her view.
Josh! The laundry!
Josh bolts up the hall, panicked. He reaches the laundry door, grabbing the handle. Hesitates.
He propels the door open with a shove, flicking on the li
The room is empty. No windows, no doors for escape...just washing machine and a dryer.
A home security officer trudges down the steps of the hou
Renai, Josh, Foster and Cali all stand outside in their pajamas, shivering in the frigid night air.
There's no one in there, it's all clear. If someone was there, they're gone now. 31.
Renai steps away from the children, out of their earshot.
I saw somebody.
Maybe it was a shadow...?
No. It wasn't a shadow, it was a man. He was tall, and he long, greasy hair. He was wearing a grey jacket. He looked right at me.
Well, like I said...he's gone now.
Renai looks to the others. Sees only disbelieving faces.
Josh's students scuffle about on stadium seating, arrangi themselves for a CLASS PHOTO. They're not doing a great j
A male photographer does his best to compose them, not do great job of hiding his bitterness about the fact that he shooting school photos instead of Vanity Fair spreads.
Okay, face the front ladies and gentlemen...come on...hold still... (muttering to himself) I'm trying to record the peak of your pathetic lives here.
Josh stands off to the side, lost in his own thoughts. Ti
Mr. Lambert, would you like to step in please?
Josh snaps out of his own head.
Uh...what?
Could you step in so that we can take the photo? Quickly please.
Just take it without me. 32.
We need you in the photo, sir.
No, you don't. Just take the damn photo without me, okay?
The class settles down, shocked by the outburst. Chastene the photographer turns to the class, gripping the camera trigger.
I can't believe this is my life. (beat; to class) Ready kids? Say asshole teacher!
The students file out of the gym. Josh sits in the bleach head buried in his hands.
I hear things.
Josh looks up, seeing Alanso.
What?
I spend so much time in the office, I hear things. I heard about your son. I'm sorry.
Thank you, Alanso.
Times like these...people realize that science doesn't have all the answers. There is a higher force at work.
I wish I had your belief. Things would be a lot simpler.
Things are simple. You just can't see it. Put your faith in Him.
He places his gold cross necklace in Josh's hand, then le Josh watches him go, then takes out his cell phone. 33.
Hey...I just found out I have to stay back tonight and finish off mid-term grades. It could be a while, there's a lot to go through. Don't wait up. Bye.
Josh sits on a park bench, staring into the distance. He takes out a flask of whisky, swigging from it.
Renai lies in bed, staring at the ceiling. Alone.
Renai shuffles in, pouring herself a glass of water. Then hears it. A low muttering. It is coming from Dalton's roo
Unnerved, Renai peers through the open door. Josh is sitt beside Dalton's bed, reading to him.
The men all walked down to the waters edge...and they stood there and asked the beast to come forth. And the beast roared back "No!". And so they dived in after it...
In the sunlight, the house looks like a happy place.
Dalton's face is a picture of serenity.
A new day-shift nurse, KELLY (29), checks on his feeding tube. Renai watches from the doorway.
You okay? 34.
Yeah.
I was going to head off for an hour or so. Are you alright here?
Of course. Anything from Dalton?
No. I'm sorry.
Renai nods. Her eyes brim with tears. The cracks are show
Keep providing him with stimuli. I've seen it work time and time again. Read to him. Even if you're doing something else, you can play him music that he likes. Don't give up.
She throws a scarf over her shoulder and stands.
I won't, I just...I haven't slept much the last couple of nights. I feel like the universe is trying to see how far I can bend before I break.
The universe picked a fight with the wrong chick.
Thanks, Kelly. You're a saint.
No, I'm not. I'm doing my job. I chose to be here. You didn't choose any of this. You're the strong one.
Renai surveys the living room. It is a total mess.
Water cascades out of a faucet. Steam rises from the wate 35.
Renai lets bath salts fall into the tub. She almost looks relaxed just smelling them.
She starts to undress, then turns --
-- and YELPS in fright.
A person is standing behind the distorted glass window, staring in at her.
The shape of the person's head and shoulders can clearly seen, but the glass is too opaque to make out any feature
Renai slips, grabbing the sink. When she glances up, the figure is gone.
Trembling, Renai opens the window. Very, very slowly.
It is fifteen feet off the ground, with a sheer drop belo
Renai sits on the front steps, alone. It is late. She loo somehow tired and wired at the same time. Smoking a cigar
Josh pulls in. Fumbles out of his car, tipsy.
What are you doing up?
It's midnight, Josh.
When did you start smoking?
You've been coming home late every single night. You've never had to do that in all of the years you've been at the school. Now all of a sudden you have to stay back late?
I don't like it either, but I'm grading tests. What choice do I have? We've gotta pay Dalton's bills.
Your mother is paying Dalton's bills, Josh. I know because she reminds me every chance she gets. 36.
Jesus, I can't win with you. That's my son in there too, not just yours!
He paces, the anger sobering him.

I've always felt like less than good enough for you. I feel it every time you mention our bills. That subtle voice that says `can't you get a job that pays more than a teacher'? And now I can't even look at you without feeling it.
You're projecting that onto me. You've written an entire story about I'm how I'm feeling without once asking me how I'm feeling.
I don't need to ask. I know you.
I am losing my mind here in this house, Josh. I'm scared and I need you and you're not here. Where are you?
I told you, I'm grading tests.
I don't mean that. I mean you're not here. With me. In this situation. You're avoiding it, like you do anything stressful, whether it's this or a parking ticket.
Christ, I should have stayed at the school.
There you go again.
Renai stands up and walks inside the house. The door clos
Josh tosses a pillow onto the couch, setting himself up f the night. He curls up on it, pulling a blanket over hims 37.
The witching hour. Still. Quiet...save for the omnipresen clock.
Dalton is as still as we've seen him. And then...he twitc A slight facial twitch, but we see it.
Josh snoozes, head arched at a bad angle. His back will regret sleeping on this couch.
Renai tosses and turns, restless in sleep.
Her eyes open and she sucks in a breath. Bad dreams.
She blinks and looks around the room, surprised to be alo sitting up in fright. Until she remembers why. She eases onto the bed. Then she looks over at the window.
There is a man standing outside it.
He is not looking in at her...he is pacing back and forth furiously smoking a cigarette. Back and forth, back and forth. Agitated. He has long, black, greasy hair and a gr jacket.
Every muscle in Renai's body freezes. She becomes a glaci
Her eyes are drilled to the man, unable to move. By sheer will, she manages to direct them towards the bedroom door Opens her mouth but no words will come. Finally--
Jo....osh....Josh....Josh...
She glances back at the window.

head_text.subj: THE MAN IS NOW IN THE ROOM.

text: He paces back and forth between the bed and the window, j as he was outside, ignoring Renai. Smoking like a fiend.
And then, suddenly, he stops pacing. Looks up. Straight a Renai - as if just realizing she was there. 38.
For a moment their eyes are locked in silence...
...and then the man's face contorts in anger and he CHARG towards her, arms outstretched, GROWLING in fury.
Renai lets out a SHRIEK of terror that could strip paint. cry from the depths of her soul.
She propels herself backward, falling off the bed and scrambling back into the corner.
Josh CHARGES into the room, flicking on the light--
--seeing only Renai, huddled in the corner, screaming.
What is it? What is it?!
Renai is incoherent. She cannot stop screaming. Josh grab her by the shoulders.
Renai, what is wrong?!
The man -- he was there -- he tried to -- there was a man there!!!
Foster runs into the room, visibly terrified. He sees his mother and instantly begins crying. He runs to his dad, holding onto his leg.
In the background, Cali begins crying, her screams contributing to an overwhelming din.
There's no one here.
I saw somebody!
There's no one here.
Don't you dare not believe me!
I believe you, okay? I just don't know what you want me to do. 39.
I want you to tell me that we can leave this house. I will not spend one more night here. I wanna leave, I wanna go!
I don't want the man to get me.
The realization that her child is terrified quiets Renai.
All is suddenly silent, save for the cries of Cali in the background. Josh holds his son tight.
You're okay, buddy. I've got you.
He and Renai exchange a look.
I'm sorry.
I can't...I want to leave this house. I can't be here anymore.
To move now would be...we would have to rent somewhere. It's not--
Please, Josh.
An agreement passes between them.
A moving truck is parked outside an average suburban home
Movers mill about, hauling boxes and couches.
Renai unpacks boxes. An elderly woman, LORRAINE (65), hel unpack. This is Josh's mother. She has a curt, disapprovi manner about her that doesn't always make her easy to lov
She is actually moving more quickly than Renai, who groan if her back were aching as she stoops down to pick up boo 40.
Lorraine, you shouldn't have to do any of this. Sit down.
Nonsense. I'm perfectly capable of putting a few things away. I did it for Josh his whole life. He never was good with tidying up.
I know, but I just feel so bad.
I think it's you who should be sitting down by the looks of it.
She boosts a photo frame from one of the boxes. It is a portrait of Renai, Dalton, Foster and Josh. In happier ti
Lorraine seems taken aback by it.
I can't believe you got Josh to sit still for a photo.
Renai reclines against the wall, surveying her new living room. Her new new house.
I can't believe we're doing all this again, that's what I can't believe. (beat; looks at her) I know you think I'm crazy.
Lorraine stops unpacking and fixes Renai with a stare. Th never really gotten along before. Adversity has brought a a truce.
Nobody - not me, not anybody - knows what you're going through right now. Whatever you have to do to get through it, do it. And never apologize for it.
Renai hugs her. It's a new thing for them and a bit awkwa
DR. BRYCE TRIMBLE (52) sits opposite Renai and Josh. Spre out in front of him are a series of X-Rays, labelled DALT LAMBERT. His office is big and expensive. 41.
Renai looks hopeful. Josh looks like a shell of a man.
We just wanna say...thank you so much. For helping us out with this, doctor. We can't tell you how much it means to have you involved.
I'm glad to help.
Unfortunately...these recent tests have proven inconclusive. There's absolutely nothing abnormal here.
Josh and Renai deflate.
So...if you're the top of the food chain with this stuff, where does that leave us?

I don't know. There is a research team in Boston who specialize in a new form of treatment. They try to stimulate the patients brain with electric pulses. It has a good success rate with victims of brain injury. We could try that.
So there's hope?
There are more things we can try.
The hope part is up to you.
Renai sits beside Dalton. Staring at him. She runs her fingers through his hair, touching his skin.
A needle touches an LP.
The pops and crackles of record hiss spit forth, followed the lilting guitar strums of `Tip Toe Through The Tulips'
The quavering falsetto of Tiny Tim accompanies the guitar 42.
Tip-toe by the window, by the window, that is where I'll be...
Renai walks away and we follow her down the hall into --
-- a mess as only a child can make.
Renai picks up a plate and a fork and knife from the floo She walks out and we DON'T CUT, tracking with her --
-- back down the hall, towards the kitchen. The records continues warbling in the background.
Oh tip-toe, from the garden, by the garden, of the willow tree...
Renai passes the living room.
What she doesn't see is the child standing in the middle the room, facing the record player.
The boy is dressed in clothes from another time, but children's clothes just the same.
He is dancing awkwardly, shifting his weight from one foo foot the other sheepishly, as if trying it for the first time.
Renai keeps walking and we stay with her as she moves pas the child, following her into the --
-- mess of the kitchen.
She sets the plate down in the sink, on top of a stack of other dirty dishes.
With a sigh she runs the hot water over the dishes.
With a sudden POP, the record starts skipping.
Bump...bump...bump... 43.
Renai shuts off the water, heading back to the living roo
She marches in, annoyed.
Then freezes.
Her bookshelf is empty. The books that once sat on it are scattered across the floor.
Bump...bump...bump...
Renai scans the books.
it...
Giggling.
She pivots her head towards the darkened hallway. There, sees a child, hidden in shadow, standing in the hall. Sta at her.
Bump...bump...bump...
Renai doesn't move. Doesn't breathe.
And then suddenly, the child turns and runs down the hall disappearing into Dalton's bedroom.
Oh my God, Dalton...no...
Summoning every ounce of strength, Renai troops down the towards Dalton's room.
Renai pushes the door open.
Dalton lies in the center of the room on his gurney. The sound is his breathing.
Renai surveys the room. It is empty.
Bump...bump...bump...
She steps inside, glancing over at a cabinet. In the foot high space beneath it, a small white shoe protrudes sligh 44.
A child's shoe.
Heart pounding, Renai bends down, peering into the darkne under the cabinet.
Bump...bump...bump...
The shoe does not have a foot in it. It is simply a disca shoe. There is no one under the cabinet.
The cabinet doors EXPLODE open as the child bursts out, giggling. Only we see that it is not a child.
It is a DWARF. A man in child's clothing. The dwarf runs Renai as she LEAPS back. He runs out of the room, gigglin All is quiet again.
Bump...bump...bump...
Renai gets up, unsure of what to do. Numb with terror.
SUDDENLY-- the record pitches back to life, the volume startling. Renai JOLTS, falling backwards.
A darkened class room.
An older janitor, NED (68), shoulders the door open, carr mop. He STARTS when he sees Josh, sitting at his desk in pale light of a desk lamp. Alone.
Josh...didn't see you there.
Sorry to scare you.
What are you up to this late?
Josh holds up his flask of whisky. He's a bit soused.
Where did all the bartenders who listen to your troubles go, Ned?
Ned nods sagely. He sets down his mop and grabs a chair, sitting in front of Josh with a sigh. He takes the flask. 45.
Never drink alone. If you take the dirty jokes out of drunkenness, all you're left with is the self loathing.
He downs a hit from the flask, then hands it back.
I don't need whisky for that.
Bah. You people think too much. Used to be, if life threw a shitstorm at you, you'd grab the nearest umbrella. Your generation would spend a day googling what brand to buy.
Josh laughs despite himself.

I probably would too. (beat; takes a drink) It's funny, I've always known I was the type of person that things didn't happen to. I made peace with it. I thought to myself, it's okay - I'll never win the lottery or climb Mount Everest...but I'll never get a rare tropical blood disease either. It works out.
Now I'm the guy whose son is in a mysterious coma.

Things happen to everybody. Even to good people like you. And they're gonna keep happening the older you get, believe me. No use sittin' in the dark drinkin' over it. Go home. Be with your wife. Tell her your what's on your mind.
He takes the flask and has another swig.
There sure as hell isn't any umbrellas `round here.
Josh pulls up to the house. Turns off the car. 46.
An old Cadillac is sitting in the driveway. Josh clambers of his car and peers in through the window of the Cadilla quizzical.
Renai is huddled on the couch in the living room, grippin knees to her chest. A man is sitting next to her; a hands soft-spoken Anglican priest, FATHER NATHANSON (40).
Josh enters. There are subtle changes in his coordination speech from the booze.
This is the first line of a joke. Guy comes home to find his wife with a priest...
Father Nathanson stands, as does Renai.
Josh, this is Liam Nathanson. A very old friend of mine.
Nice to meet you. I've heard a lot about you.
Can't say I've heard the same, Liam. At least I know you're not sleeping with her.
Don't be rude, Josh.
Josh turns to see his mother, holding a tray of tea. He f
What is going on here?
I should be going. Thank you so much for the tea.
Thanks, Liam.
He clears his throat and exits, quickly and quietly.
Okay, would anyone mind telling me what the hell is going on here? 47.
Please sit down, Joshua.
"Joshua?" Oh Jesus...
Sit down.
The melodramatic way in which you two are conducting yourselves right now is scaring the shit out of me, so just tell me what's wrong.
Nothing is wrong. We want to talk.
Nobody asks you to sit down unless something is wrong. If a doctor calls you into his office and asks you to sit down, you're fucked.
There's no use, Lorraine. He's been drinking.
I have not been drinking. Not enough that we can't talk to each other, Renai. And don't judge me in that bitchy tone, okay?
He would never speak to me like that before.

Christ. You're acting like I'm some lush who comes home and beats you with a belt. At least I'm speaking to you. You suddenly have to speak to a priest. Or my mother who, up until a couple of weeks ago, you couldn't stand.
You're an asshole.
Your wife needs you. Now sit down and listen to her. I won't ask you again. 48.
Josh obeys. His mothers tone can still shut him up.
Go on, Renai. Tell him.
This...thing that was in the other house. It followed us.
Josh shifts in his seat. Agitated.
Let her speak.
I saw someone again today. In the house. It looked like a young boy. I followed it into Dalton's room... but it wasn't a child.
This thing is here. I know it.
So...what? You called in a priest to get rid of it?
I didn't know what else to do.
Are you kidding me?
Was this your idea?
No. It was mine.
You've never been to a church in your life. Now you're inviting a priest into our home? I feel like I don't even know you right now.
I'm scared.
This is a fantasy, and you need a therapist, not a member of the clergy.
I told you... 49.
What's happening to Renai is real. I've seen it for myself.
I came here today because last night I had a dream about this place.
We are FLOATING through the corridor, looking through Lorraine's POV.
We are inside her dream.
I was in this house...but it was late at night.
The POV keeps moving, out of the kitchen and into the hal
I tried to be quiet. I didn't want to wake anybody. I was afraid.
The POV floats down the hall, reaching a door. The door opens, revealing Josh and Renai, sleeping.
I looked into your bedroom. You were both asleep.
The POV keeps moving down the hall.
I knew that I was asleep in the dream...but I could feel that someone was awake in the house.
We keep pushing on, reaching the door to Dalton's room.
I went into Dalton's room.
The door pushes open. In the dark, we can see Dalton, in
There was someone in there with him.
The POV turns to see a DARK FIGURE, standing in the corne
A man was standing in the corner of the room.
I asked him who he was...he said he was a visitor. I asked him what he wanted...he said Dalton.
Lorraine is clearly unsettled by the dream.
I can still hear that voice.
She looks up at Josh - and SCREAMS!

Over Josh's shoulder, crouched down behind the couch and peeking up over the armrest at Lorraine, is a DIABOLICAL FIGURE. His face is PURE RED with smeared lipstick. His s is completely bald, yet tufts of hair dangle above his ea Other than his face, his skin is charcoal black.
Lorraine recoils back, utterly petrified.
What is it?
Lorraine stares eerily into his eyes. Frozen.
He's here.
Renai looks to Josh, who is at a total loss. She is cryin
Help us...
His anger fades and he steps over and takes her in his ar
I don't know how.
I know somebody who can help...if you're willing to ask for it.
A battered van is parked in the driveway of the house.
Renai and Josh stand in front of two men. They are silent 51.
The shorter one is a wiry young man who looks like he spe most of his time in dark rooms. Not a member of the beach volleyball team. This is SPECS (32).
The other is TUCKER (33), a larger man with scruffy facia hair. He is eating a Hot Pocket.
So you must be Josh?
Yeah.
That wasn't psychic. Lorraine told me your name.
Oh.
I'm Specs. (beat; spooky voice) I'm here to solve your problem. I'm just kidding with the voice. We take this very seriously.
So is Elise coming or...?
She won't be joining us yet. Usually we handle all the background stuff, then she gets involved when we have the facts.
Helps weed out the nutjobs.
Okay...
This is a little uncomfortable. Speaking for myself. I'm not used to this kind of stuff.
We understand completely. Ninety six per cent of the people we deal with have had no experience with this type of phenomena before.
He takes out a notepad and pen. 52.
I would like to start by interviewing you both. Can we record your answers?
Ah...sure.
My assistant will check different areas of the house for electrical anomalies. I'll get him started. Tucker, would you follow me?
Specs leads Tucker into the kitchen.
Assistant?
Could you not eat that in front of the clients?
Assistant?
Finish it in here. This industry gets laughed at enough as it is.
Specs is halfway through interviewing Josh and Renai.
Do you or any of your children suffer from epilepsy or autism?
No. I mean, our son...
Right. I heard about this from Lorraine. He is in a coma, the cause of which is unknown?
Yes. 53.
Do either of you habitually use drugs or alcohol?
No.
No drugs at all?
I take anti-depressants sometimes.
Do you have a history of clinical depression?
Not a history. I've had bouts of it. In the past.
Renai is uncomfortable. Specs makes a note. The camera be
Tucker, could you check the camera?
I'm still assisting in the other room.
Whenever you're ready then.
A long beat. Tucker finally enters, adjusts the camera.
(to Renai and Josh) He handles administration, I handle technical. It's an even split. He couldn't change a light bulb and I'm no good with paperwork. It bores me senseless.
Specs clears his throat, peeved. Continues.
Do you have any history of sexual abuse in the family?
No.
I'm sorry, I have to ask how this relates to our problem? 54.
Nine times out of ten, when someone comes to us with a problem like this, it's because of an inward cause within the family unit...not a physical force outside of it.
Specs and Tucker mill around the room. Tucker is carrying small electronic device. He holds it against the wall.
What is that?
Tri-field meter. It measures DC fields and the natural electro magnetic environment.
Sometimes old wiring can leak into the atmosphere. It can cause hallucinations, changes in energy.
Yeah. It's a little more complicated than that, but, you know, you get the general idea.
It's basically that.
Not really, but whatever.
The tech stuff's not relevant to you anyway.
It's very relevant, but it's all good.
Tucker edges into the corridor. He switches out the light then takes what looks like a modified VIEW-MASTER TOY out his shoulder bag, holding it up to his eyes.
He stalks down the corridor with it. All is quiet. 55.
TUCKER'S POV THROUGH VIEWMASTER - different filters highl different degrees of UV light. Each slide changes the readings.
He approaches the grandfather clock. Another slide clicks into place - showing us TWO FIGURES. Standing beside the clock.
In the negative light, they look like females.
Tucker lowers the device. There is no one there.
Specs packs up the video equipment, babbling to Josh and Renai.
Epilepsy in one of the children mostly. It's very common. If we approach things academically, it lets us find the genuinely interesting cases.
Tucker backs into the room. Very slowly. He is afraid.
I think we can call Elise now...
Josh opens the door to see an elderly woman, ELISE RAINIE (73), who despite her years maintains a sprightly energy.
There is absolutely nothing morbid or dour about her.
Mrs. Rainier?
No, my mother couldn't come, it's just me. Elise. You must be Lorraine's son? You've grown since I last saw you.
Last saw me?
Your mother and I have been friends for a long time. 56.
Elise steps inside. Renai, Tucker and Specs gather around Everyone becomes very subservient, like the Queen just ar
(re Specs and Tucker) They're very good assistants but I can't get them to dress any better.
Hi. I'm Renai.
Pleased to meet you. I'm Elise.
Elise takes her hat off and scans the room, taking a deep breath. Tucker jabbers, eager to please.
We took Tri-field and EMF readings of the whole house. All the wiring, alarm clocks, radios, toasters, TV, record player, fuse box. Nothing went off the charts.
And the previous home?
Tucker and Specs look at each other. Oh shit.
Tucker hadn't monitored that yet. I could jump on that this afternoon if you like? Make up for lost time.
Yeah, but who would work the equipment? I'll need to be there. You know what, don't even sweat it. I'll make myself available.
No, that's fine, gentlemen.
She stares up at the ceiling, as if seeing something they
I don't think bad wiring is the problem here.
She drifts over to the bookshelf, her hand landing on the of photo albums Renai looked through in the opening scene
Hmm. 57.
Renai and Josh exchange a look.
May I walk through the house?
Yes. Of course.
Steven, do you have your sketchbook?
Specs hurriedly fishes a sketchbook and pencil out of his
Yes, I do. Yes, I do. Yes, yes. I do.
Good. We're going to need it.
What is it for?
She tells me what she sees and I draw it. It's the most important part of her process.
His drawings and my photos comprise her visual records.
Especially the drawings.
That's debatable.
It's not debatable.
It is, but whatever.
Onwards and upwards. Find me a ghost.
Elise begins walking through the house. Tucker and Specs trail her and we FOLLOW THEM into the--
--hallway. 58.
Renai and Josh stay back, sheepish. Elise stalks forward the front, surveying every nook and cranny of the house.
Elise stops suddenly. She is staring straight at a corner the hallway, next to the grandfather clock.
What is it?
There is something here.
This is where I saw it.
Elise calmly mutters something to Specs in a low voice, b we have trouble hearing it - only snatches of key words.
...long hair...grey dress...her eyes are...
He immediately starts sketching. His line drawings are fa but detailed. Impressive.
He outlines the wall, the ceiling lamp, the grandfather clock.
And then something else...
Two young women. Standing next to the grandfather clock, dressed in Amish garb. Even in the roughness of the drawi we can make out their pleading eyes and pale skin.
Tucker takes out a camera, snaps some shots. Josh and Ren step forward, seeing the sketch.
Elise keeps moving, heading straight for one door in particular. She stops, running her hand over the wood.
Do I have permission to enter this room?
Go ahead.
Maybe you could wait back there?
Josh and Renai hug each other. Tucker lowers the camera.
Elise grips the door handle and turns it. 59.
The door groans open.
Dalton is lying on his gurney, surrounded by the sluggish drone of hospital equipment. The curtains are drawn and t room is dark.
Elise hesitates...then steps inside.
Leave the lights off.
Elise steps closer to Dalton. She runs her hands over his prone body. She shivers as she does.
A ripple of fear passes through her. Her breath quickens.
Slowly...very very slowly ...she gazes up at a corner of the ceiling. Her eyes WIDEN and the look on her face

head_text.subj: T E R R O R.

text: Her arm raises up, her finger extending and pointing at t corner she is glaring at.
What is it? What do you see?
Elise cups her hand over her mouth and whispers to Specs, keeping her eyes GLUED to the far corner of the ceiling. cannot hear what she is whispering.
Hand shaking, Specs feverishly starts to sketch. We canno see what he is drawing.
What do you see?!
The strokes of Specs' pencil become faster and rougher, keeping up with Elise's whispers. Sweat dots his forehead
Tucker glances at the drawing and steps back instinctivel He holds up his Viewmaster.
POV THROUGH VIEWMASTER - we see the far corner of the cei change color as Tucker rotates the lenses inside...but nothing out of the ordinary appears. Just a ceiling.
Tell me! 60.
Suddenly, Renai charges forward, snatching the sketch boo
The drawing is of a hideous form - crouched in the corner the ceiling, staring down at Dalton below. It is the RED- FACED DEMON Lorraine saw earlier.
His naked body is charcoal black...whilst also strangely translucent, the veins visible underneath the flesh. A corpulent stomach juts out, as if he were pregnant.
Terrified, Renai flicks on the light --
-- revealing nothing but an ordinary ceiling.
Elise holds court in the living room.
Renai and Josh hold each other, struggling to comprehend
I'm not sure if you are ready to hear this yet...but unfortunately I can't waste any time easing you into it. There is no time left.
She takes a deep breath, preparing herself.
I want you to know that this is what I believe and it may contradict a previous medical diagnosis. However, you called me here and I am taking that as an acceptance of my readings.
Go on.
Your son...is not in a coma. His physical body is here, but his spiritual body is not.
The reason these disturbances followed you to a new home is because...it is not the house that is haunted. It is your son.
This is too much for Josh. Renai, however, wants to liste
I don't understand... 61.
Elise considers what she is about to say carefully.
Have you ever heard of astral projection?
Out of body experiences?
Elise nods.

I call them travellers. These are people with the ability to leave their physical body and travel to different places in an astral form. To some degree, we all have the ability to do it...but most of us subconsciously suppress it or don't know how to access it.
Josh shakes his head, agitated. Renai leans forward, desperate for an answer to her terror.
Dalton is...a very accomplished astral projector. He has been since he was very young. He's not afraid of his ability. And that lack of fear has led him to travel too far and become lost...
Lost? Lost where?
Elise gazes up at the ceiling, as if looking into another
In The Further.
What do you mean?

The Further is that place beyond our perception, beyond our understanding of the physical world that we can see and touch. It is a place without clocks or measurements, without past or future...an infinite realm that holds all of our dreams...and all of our nightmares.
She turns to look at them. 62.
That is where Dalton is.
Renai cries, unprepared for what she is hearing.
The problem is that with his astral body gone, he has left a physical body with us. An empty vessel.
Josh can't meet her gaze.
And there are entities that know this. They can smell it - the chance to live again. That is why they have gathered around him.
How many are there?

There are five benevolent spirits. Five different entities for whom Dalton has become a most prized possession. They are trying to get inside his physical body...and they get closer with each passing day.
Her words hang in the air like gunsmoke. Pure fear course through Josh's eyes. He fidgets, agitated.
Then there are two entities who are...not benevolent. One of them takes the form of a man, the other...
She holds up the drawing that Specs di.
They work together, so desperate are they to possess Dalton. They are the closest of all the entities to getting inside him.
I don't want to scare you, but I have never, in all my years of doing this, experienced anything as terrifying as their presence.
Is there a way to bring Dalton back? 63.
There is something we could try. A way of calling him back. I would need your complete trust.
Josh can't take it any more. He stands up.
No. No. This has gone too far.
You said that you'd give her a chance!

I have given her a chance, and I did that because I wanted to help you. But I cannot have somebody telling us that the reason our son is in a coma is because his soul is floating off somewhere in another dimension.
I know this is hard to hear.
No, it's not fair is what it is. You're preying on people's grief and vulnerability, which is really easy to do in a situation like this.
Why did we go to all the trouble of bringing them here if you're just going to reject what they say?
Because I wanted to help you. To put your mind at ease, and if this helped, then great. But to drag Dalton into this? No.
Josh, you're not being fair...
Fair? How did the voice of reason become the bad guy here? Don't you see? You want to believe. Of course you do, honey, anybody would.
The room goes quiet. Josh turns to Elise. 64.

Look, I appreciate what you're trying to do. I really do. But I think it's dangerous to start throwing out false hope like this. I have to put my foot down. My wife is not...mentally well at the moment, and I have to keep at least one of her feet here in the real world.
You never believed me...
Honey, I'm on your side. But I genuinely think this is dangerous and frankly, a little exploitative.
He turns to Elise, Specs and Tucker.

You come into a home with a seriously ill child, you make a tenuous connection between him and these experiences Renai is having and viola - the client starts crying because they're desperate to believe, the tears validate your power, thank you, that'll be six hundred dollars please.
We reject more cases than we take. We're not out for money, sir.
I know, I know...look, I appreciate your interest and your time. I do. Thank you. Thank you very much.
He goes to the front door, opening it.
I completely understand. And I honestly don't blame you for reacting like this.
She walks to the door, followed by Specs and Tucker, who sling their bags over their shoulders sheepishly.
No, please...don't go. 65.
Thank you for your time.
They exit. The door closes. They are gone.
Renai lies in bed, awake...a broken shell of her former s A bottle of anti-depressants sits on the bedside table.
Josh enters the bedroom. Sits down beside her.
Look at me for a second, honey.
Look at me.
She doesn't look up.
Did you really believe what she said? In your heart of hearts, did you actually take what she was saying literally?
A long beat of silence passes.
I don't know...

Do you think I don't want to believe in that stuff? Of course I do. It would make life a lot easier if I did. If I believed that some supernatural force was responsible for what's happened to our son...

I don't believe anything anymore, Josh. I used to. I used to believe that I could keep my children safe. I used to believe everything would be okay. To believe in something, you have to know it to be true.
She turns and looks at him.
The things that have happened to me haven't confirmed any beliefs - they've done the opposite. They've made me question what I believe.
They've made me realize that maybe we don't know as much as we think we do.
Josh paces, at his wits end.
You ask me if I believe what she said to be true and the answer is I don't know. But let me ask you this - in your heart of hearts, can you say for certain that it isn't?
Josh lies beside Renai, who is sleeping. He is wide awake staring at the ceiling.
He gets out of bed.
The door opens.
All is mute as Josh enters, skulking carefully through th darkness.
The curtains lull in the slightest of breezes.
Josh stands over Dalton.

He stares down at his sons body, then lets his gaze drift around the room...past the CLOSET, past the DRAWINGS pinn to the wall and the TOYBOX...all the way to the CORNER of ceiling that Elise was so frightened of. Josh's eyes dril into the shadows.
Is there something waiting there?
Finally, Josh sits down beside Dalton. He grips his sons
Where are you? Where did you go?
Can you hear me? I'm begging you to show me that you can hear me...I don't know how to help you. Please tell me what to do.
Josh's torment fills the air...but Dalton doesn't move. 67.
Please God, please help me...give me my son back. I will do anything just to have him back.
Josh studies Dalton's face for a response. Nothing. Not a twitch. He collapses forward onto Dalton. Holding him tig
I need him back. I need him to show me that he can hear me. Please...
For a moment, all we can hear is Josh's breathing.
Then...something happens. Something Josh doesn't see.
Dalton's face twitches. It is a very slight movement. Thi movement is followed by something that is hard to miss--
One of the tacks pinning one of Dalton's drawings to the begins to wind loose.
It pops free, shooting across the room like a kernel of popcorn...followed by another tack.
The second tack lands in Josh's lap. Puzzled, he picks it examining it. He looks up, his eye drawn to the picture o the wall.
With total astonishment, he sees the two remaining tacks works themselves free, popping out of the wall.
The drawing floats down to the ground.
Josh stoops down, picking it up.
It is a drawing split into two halves. The left half is a self portrait of Dalton, lying in bed, looking down from above.
The right half is a depiction of outer space - squiggly s and bloated planets.
Dalton has drawn another version of himself on this side, flying above the house with another man.
At the bottom of the first drawing, Dalton has written `L night I watched myself sleep'.
A tear falls down Josh's face. He begins to cry. Deep and painful tears he has long pent up.
Beneath the second drawing, Dalton has written `Then I fl 68.
Renai's eyes flutter open. She glances over. No one is th
Renai shuffles into the kitchen.
Josh is sitting at the kitchen table, staring at Dalton's drawing. He hasn't slept and looks it. He looks up at her
Okay.
Renai approaches Josh and they hug...holding on for dear
The Lambert house is lit from within. Like a Jack-O-Lante
Action stations.
Tucker sets up two stills camera's around Dalton's room, zipping back and forth between the two tripods. Specs ope up a kit, taking out his notepad and a pencil.
A small, circular table has been set up, adjacent to Dalt bed. Elise sits at the table, flanked on either side by J and Renai.

What's most important is that you realize no two attempts are the same. I will be completely honest with you about the results, and if no dialogue is established, I will tell you. I am not in the business of embellishing success. What happens, happens.
Josh and Renai nod grimly, truly out of their depth.
Forget the limits and laws and logic of this world. We are treading in a different place now.
Tucker finally sets his cameras and takes a seat in the c holding up a HAND-HELD VIDEO CAMERA. 69.
These still cameras are rigged to pick up changes in the atmosphere, electrical or temperature-wise. Don't be alarmed if they go off.
Everything I say while I am in tune will be at a very low volume, so you won't hear any of it. Steven will write it down and repeat it for you.
Specs waits obediently at her side.
Hold on to each other, and stay focused. You'll see things you don't understand. Confusing things. Do not question them or speak in any way.
She turns to Specs.
Dim the lights please.
Tucker reaches up and dims the lights to a very low level
Elise closes her eyes, concentrating. She relaxes her hea as if meditating, letting it loll on her shoulders.
One of the cameras on the tripod goes off, bathing the ro in white light for a split second.
Elise inhales and exhales deeply, slipping away. Soon, sh very still.
Specs nods to Tucker silently, then produces an odd looki device made from GREY CLOTH.

It almost resembles a gas mask from World War 1, with a c shaped muzzle that fits over the mouth and nose. The snou the facemask is like an elongated elephant trunk, coiling outwards and ending in an old listening device, like an e version of a microphone.
Specs slips two hooks over Elise's ears and gently places device over her nose and mouth. He then takes a seat next her, behind Renai, who holds Elise's hand.
Specs takes out his notepad and fixes a small apparatus around his neck that holds a flashlight in place. 70.
He flicks it on, then holds the microphone end of Elise's facemask up to his ear, a pencil gripped in the other han
Dead silence descends over the group like a blanket.
Then, we hear something lilt through the old microphone. is Elise's muttered whispers. Specs begins writing.
Renai opens her eyes to peek at what he is scribbling in cursive.
we are calling out to you dalton Renai grips Josh's hand tightly.
We are calling out to you Dalton.
tell us that you are safe tell us where you are
Tell us that you are safe. Tell us where you are.
For what seems like an eternity, all is quiet and still..
...until Elise's eyelids flutter.
Another unintelligible whisper drifts out of the micropho at Specs' ear. He writes. who's there?
Who's there? it is your mother and father we have been looking for you
It is your mother and father. We have been looking for you.
Long pause. Specs writes again, more intense this time.
i need help i can't see in here
I need help...I can't see in here. 71.
follow my voice dalton come back to us
Follow my voice Dalton. Come back to us.
Another long pause. A little too long.
Why aren't you talking anymore dalton?
Why aren't you talking anymore Dalton?
A long beat. Tucker's camera flash goes off again.
if they hear me they'll hurt me
If they hear me, they'll hurt me.
who will hurt you?
Who will hurt you?
the man with fire on his face
The man with fire on his face.
can you find your way back to us?
Can you find your way back to us?
there is no way out
There is no way out.
follow my voice dalton
Follow my voice Dalton.
be quiet they'll hear you 72.
Be quiet, they'll hear you.
they won't hear you just follow my voice
They won't hear you, just follow my voice.

they are coming they heard you help me helpme mom and dad please save me please come and get mepleasecomeandgetmecome Elise's head TWITCHES as Specs' writes furiously, trying keep up. His pencil finally SNAPS. He snatches up another
dalton are you there? dalton? An agonizing ocean of silence...then this furious scrawl:
listen to me you filthy whore he isnt here you should not have come here you fucking bitch i will rip your cunt apart and eat the fucking innards that spill forth from it i
Specs writing begins to SHRED the paper as he writes furiously, the scrawl getting out of control. Sweat flies from his forehead as he struggles to get it all down.
Suddenly a PIERCING SCREAM blasts through the microphone he jerks it away from his ear - then looks over at Elise.
With UTTER DREAD, he sees that she is NO LONGER WEARING T MASK. She has taken it off and is panting heavily.
The scream continues through the mic, audible to everyone...then peters out.
Shocked silence follows.
Josh glances over at Dalton's bed.
He is not in it. 73.
Stunned, Josh turns back to the table--

head_text.subj: --TO SEE DALTON SITTING NEXT TO HIM. STARING AT HIM.

text: His heart leaps out of his skin and so does Renai's as th both turn towards Dalton. Their son.
Dalton stares at them...not a trace of emotion on his fac
Then he reaches up and grips his bottom jaw with both han wrenching it downwards with almighty force and BREAKING H OWN JAW.
Renai SCREAMS into the abyss as Dalton BELLOWS at them, s flying from his throat, his tongue hanging down over his dislocated jaw.
He stamps his foot and the table - and everyone sitting a it, Renai, Josh and Elise - go flying backwards as if pus by a hurricane, smashing into the wall with crushing powe
We realize that Dalton was not sitting at the table, but squatting down awkwardly. Painfully.
He stands up, then steps forward. As Josh and Renai watch his KNEE begins to BEND BACKWARDS, the tendons stretching snapping, the knee bending in the opposite direction.
His other knee follows and he steps forward - both knees bending back.
Specs is rigid in his chair, rooted to the spot, notepad still in hand. When he looks up at Dalton, the flashlight under his chin shines in Dalton's eyes.
Dalton ROARS and advances forward - SLAPPING Specs with t force of ten men. Specs reels backwards, hitting the wall smashing his head and crumpling like paper.
Elise stands to face Dalton. The CAMERA FLASH goes off ag lighting the darkened room for a split second and showing Elise the lipstick-smeared face of a demon instead of Dalton's face.
Tucker SHRINKS BACK as he captures all this with the vide
Dalton steps forward again and Elise CHARGES at him, grab Dalton by the hair.
Leave this vessel! Leave this vessel!
Dalton BELLOWS again - a howl so course and ungodly that seems ripped straight from the bowels of Lucifer himself. 74.
Dalton FLIES backwards, hitting the corner of the wall an then CLIMBING IT, arcing his body into the far corner of ceiling like an expert contortionist.
He hisses at them as the CAMERA FLASH fires AGAIN AND AGA showing them split second frames of the red faced CREATUR
Leave this earthly body!
Dalton shrieks again and somehow the force of the cry kno Elise down.
The room begins to shake.
Books fly.
The closet doors burst open.
With terror, Elise looks over and sees several figures peering out from within the closet.
Two are the women that Specs' drew. Another is a small ma dressed like a child.
They stare out at Elise, their eyes glinting in the dark.
Elise turns to see Josh. The camera flash STROBES repeate and gives us split-second glimpses of an OLD WOMAN, dress in Victorian era garb - standing directly behind Josh.
And then, with absolute fear, Renai sees the LONG HAIRED standing over her. He SCREAMS at her and pushes her again the wall, licking her. She cries out, terrified.
With the spirit world, crashing in around her, Elise pull herself off the floor and yells again.
Leave his body!
Dalton suddenly SPASMS, dropping out of the corner and hitting the floor like a rag doll dropped off a bridge.
The lights!
Terrified, Specs' scrambles over to the corner, flicking light switch. The room is instantly flooded with light.
The room has stopped shaking. The screaming has stopped. 75.
Dalton!
Renai wrenches herself across the carpet and reaches Dalt limp body.
Dalton! Dalton!
She listens for breathing. His chest moves. He is still breathing. She holds him and cries. More desperate than e
Tucker, Specs and Elise convene in the kitchen, slumped amongst the boxes for the tech gear. All are in shock.
I feel like a mountain climber who's been waiting his whole life to climb Everest, and now that I'm standing on the summit, I don't know what to do with myself...
I'll tell you what we do with ourselves. We make a short list of our preferred media outlets, that's what.
He holds up his video camera.
Watch this.
He hits play on a monitor that his video camera is cabled Chaotic images of Dalton from the previous scene SPIT to
BEHIND DALTON, we can just make out the blurry image of t RED-FACED DEMON. Puppeteering Dalton from behind. Control his limbs like a human marionette.
Oh my God...
After all the years we've been dining out on morsels like a faucet that turns itself on and off...we finally have some empirical evidence of the real thing. Proof.
He hits pause on the video, freeze-framing the hellish im 76.
Proof? Proof of what? Nine tenths of the world believes that when you die, your soul ascends to sit with God. Would you be telling them something they didn't already know?
That is so not the point. This is not about religion. Here we have irrefutable evidence of a paranormal experience. Our job is to share it.

No, our job is not to alert the press and prove the existence of the `paranormal', as you call it. I'm not out to prove anything. I've known there was a higher plane ever since I was a little girl and I could play hopscotch with people whose names were inscribed on tombstones. What you call paranormal is a fact of life for me.
Our job is to help people. The least we can do is spare them the indignity of Sixty Minutes.
She snatches his camera away from him and stands up.
Yeah, until they get their book deal...then you'll wish you'd listened.
No, I won't, Tucker. I'll just be proud of you. You two stared down something that would crush most mortals tonight and you stood tall.
They manage a smile.
So what do we do now?
We answer the door.
What do you mean?
There is a knock at the front door. 77.
Josh sits with Renai's head in his lap. She is too traumatized to speak. Rain dribbles down the window pane.
Josh gets up when he hears the knock at the door. Elise shuffles over to answer it.
She opens the door to reveal Lorraine, wet from the downp
Elise steps aside and Lorraine walks in, gravely sedate.
Mom...what are you doing here?
I asked your mother to come over. I called her immediately after...the session. I told her to hurry over.
Why?
Lorraine's usual strong will has evaporated. She looks to
There is something we must talk about. Sit down, Lorraine.
Lorraine follows orders, easing onto the sofa. Eyes down.
Thunder growls in the distance.
Go on. Tell him.
Tell me what?
Lorraine swallows and starts talking.
The reason...I knew to call Elise in this situation...the reason I know her so well...is because I called her myself once. Years ago.
She looks up at Josh.
To help you, Josh.
What are you talking about? 78.
Lorraine can't go on. Elise steps in.
It's no accident that your son is such a gifted traveller. The ability was handed down to him.
By his father.
We have returned to the opening scene.
We are looking down on a sleeping child. Chest rising and falling with each breath.
This is JOSH as a child.
We move away from him, exploring the dark room.
Tucker and Specs enter the room, lingering at the back.
No...I've never...done that before.
When you were about eight...you suffered night terrors. Awful fits of pure fear. You were terrified of an old woman who you said would come to visit you at night.
Again we return to the opening scene...floating down a lo hallway.
A window at the end of the hall enlarges as we approach.
Someone is standing in front of it. 79.
The murky silhouette of the figure turns and walks away. follow it, tentative. Turning a corner, we see the figure Standing in a doorway.
Now we can make out the edges of the figure. It is an old woman. Hair in a Victorian bun. A corseted dress.

head_text.subj: IT IS THE SAME OLD WOMAN THAT ELISE SAW.

text: Let me in.
Lorraine closes her eyes, struggling to go on.
I dismissed your stories. Told you to grow up.
Then I saw her for myself.
She looks to Elise, who nods.
Hand trembling, Lorraine retrieves a packet from within h coat. The paper is yellowing. Faded. Soaked from the rain
Lorraine hands the packet to Josh, who is dumbfounded.
Renai peers over Josh's shoulder, at a Polaroid of a boy, about nine years old, sitting on a couch. Early 70s perio
It is a Young Josh. Behind him is the BLURRED OUTLINE OF FIGURE.
Josh runs his finger over the shadow. His heart rate spee up. An old memory is coming back to him.
At first, I thought it was a camera problem. Then I saw her again.
Josh flips to the next photo - it is another faded frame Josh as a youngster. This time he stands in an old kitche
Once again, there is a figure behind him - clearer this t but still hidden in silhouette. A step closer to Josh.
Josh flips to the next picture. A BLACK AND WHITE shot of himself as a young boy, lying in bed. 80.
With dread, Josh sees the unmistakable features of an OLD WOMAN, crouching beside his bed. Staring at him.
In each photo, she got closer and closer to you...
Josh flips to the next picture - in this one, Young Josh standing by a car.
Behind him, the details of the Old Woman's dress are visi Her arm is extended...reaching out for Josh's neck.
Renai's hand flies to her mouth.
Finally, I was so scared, I called Elise.
Sweat pours down Josh's brow.
He lets the photographs flutter from his fingers, backing away. Fragments of memories rock his entire body.
