I don't...I don't remember any of this...
You've blocked it out.
But in the back of your mind, you're still afraid of having your picture taken, aren't you?
Josh grabs the wall, weak at the knees.
I've kept the photos hidden ever since then...until tonight.
I advised Lorraine to hide them. To stop taking your picture. And to let you forget.
Who is she?
A parasite. She befriended your astral body, then drew you out into The Further, just as Dalton has been drawn out.
But she deceived you. All she wanted was an empty vessel. A physical body. Yours.
I'm sorry, Josh.
I didn't want to make you remember this...I only do it for the sake of your son.
A quiet descends over them.
Your son is out there.
And you are the only one who can bring him back.
Josh looks up at her.
How long do we have before...that thing...takes him over completely?
All eyes are on Elise.
If you cannot reach him tonight, then he is gone forever.
The lights have been dimmed. Josh sits on a single person lounge chair.
Elise sits opposite him.
Tucker and Specs set up around her, fixing their cameras place. Renai leans forward on the couch opposite, chewing nails to the quick. Lorraine is next to her.
Remember who you are and why you are traveling. Keep one foot in this world.
Are you ready?
Josh nods. Renai hugs him and they hold onto it. She whis to him, staring into his eyes. 82.
I want you to know something...you have never been less than good enough for me. You've always been perfect for me. You're my best friend...my soulmate. I love you so much.
I love you too. I have since the first time you looked at me. I don't exist without you.
Elise drifts over to the piano, lifting the METRONOME fro
She sets it down in front of Josh, freeing the weighted s arm so it moves back and forth.
Close your eyes, Josh...and relax. Breathe deeply. Let all life around you fade out into the background...until the only thing you can hear is the ticking of the metronome.
We PUSH IN on Josh, inhaling and exhaling. TICK...TICK...
Focus on a spot in the center of your forehead. Feel that spot getting further away as you drift off to sleep.
We are now in an ECU of Josh. TICK...TICK...TICK.
I want you to relax your physical body and let the astral body gain strength...feel it rising out of your chest.
Renai watches, literally and figuratively on the edge of seat. Tucker and Specs take notes from the corner.
Josh breathes deeply. Eyes shut tightly.
Detach yourself.
Josh's eyes open suddenly and he stands up, frustrated, marching across the living room. 83.
This is useless...I have no idea what I'm doing and you just suddenly expect me to...
He turns around and stops dead. His words trail off.
He sees his own body, sitting in the armchair, eyes close Elise is sitting opposite, with her back to the Josh who now standing.
The living room is exactly as it was - only Renai, Lorrai Tucker and Specs have disappeared. They are nowhere to be seen.
Stunned into mute shock, Josh stares at his own body in t armchair.
Slowly, Elise turns her head away from the Josh in the ch staring eerily into the standing Josh's eyes.
She can see him.
Now you are free.
Keep your guide, and a steady stride...and into The Further you go.
She turns back to the Josh in the chair. The room seems t have darkened even more somehow.
Josh turns and glares into the darkness of his hallway as yawns outwards, eventually swallowed by complete blacknes
He is not in another world. He is in his own house.
NOTE - The following scenes are not going to be "movie quiet". They will be inhumanly quiet. There will no score Only sound scape. This is another world and should feel s
Josh moves forward, gliding down the hall slowly. He look down and sees that his feet are slighty raised off the ground.
He is floating.
He moves into the darkness of the hall...past the bedroom doors and closet doors. 84.
As he floats past, he scans every darkened corner for the slightest trace of movement.
He reaches the front door. He moves towards it and as he it OPENS.

location: NOT NIGHT OR DAY, BUT DARK

text: His street beckons beyond the door.
Josh floats across his lawn.
There are no people or cars on the street...it is as deso as a post-apocalyptic wasteland.
Some lights flicker from within the houses, but no moveme or signs of human forms. Only mist.
Josh floats an inch above the road, moving down the stree

One thing to notice is that there is a total lack of hori or city scape here...Josh's immediate surroundings are visible for about one hundred yards or so...anything beyo that, in any direction, fades into blackness. As if someo were shining a giant spotlight down on him.
Renai watches Josh. He is completely still...in a trance.
His eyelids flutter as his eyeballs probe in all directio underneath.
He's in...
Josh keeps moving, his fear registering, even in this wor
He looks down at his feet.
He is frustrated that he can't move any faster. He concentrates with fierce intensity--
--and then watches as his feet touch the ground. 85.
He is walking.
He starts to move faster, gaining control of his movement
Dalton?
The sound of his voice is strangely dead - as if he were inside a soundproof recording studio. There are no walls angles for it to bounce off.
Dalton? Where are you?
For a long time, there is nothing...
...then he sees it.
A figure...shrouded in shadow. Standing on the street cor with his back to Josh.
Josh moves towards the figure.
Closer. Closer.
The man abruptly turns the corner without looking back.
Josh glances around the corner. There is nobody there.
He continues down the street. He sees a little girl. Far the distance, but close enough to focus on. She stands an stares...
...then turns and walks away. Gone...like an apparition.
He looks to his right and sees--
Behind a curtain in one of the windows, back lit by candl light. As with the others, the shadow turns away and disappears.
Josh walks towards the front door of the house. He reache and turns the handle.
A long corridor beckons. As with all of this world, it is dark here. 86.
Josh walks into the corridor, looking to his left and rig into empty rooms. Living rooms and bedrooms. Devoid of li
The colors are muted...the palate drained. Only REDS and BLACKS pop out. Blood and darkness.
Josh keeps moving down the corridor.
Up ahead, he sees a figure run past the top of the hall, ignoring Josh.
He presses forward, following the figure.
Dalton?
He glances into an empty kitchen. Food rots on the table.
His footsteps have no sound as he continues on.
Dalton?
He passes a door that is partly open. He pushes it wide o
The room is small and empty. A strange room...like a stag
A figure is sitting in the corner, facing the wall like a child being punished at school.
Josh steps closer, cautious. Takes another step.
Where is Dalton?
He steps closer yet again.
His hand reaches out to touch the figures back...
...his fingers are almost grazing the figures shoulder.
Soft laughter behind him. Josh glances back to look for t source.
When he turns back, the FIGURE IS GONE.
He wheels around, seeing the small-statured figure of the DWARF that Renai encountered, stepping through the door o the room. 87.
Josh sidles back into the corridor. His pace is sluggish, dream-like.
Frustrated, he stops. Then turns to his left.

head_text.subj: SOMEONE IS RIGHT THERE IN HIS FACE. A MAN.

text: The man is not looking at him...only standing very close. neck lolls on his shoulders...around and around. He seems stuck on a loop. He is dressed in a fifties era suit.
Do you know where Dalton is?
The man doesn't acknowledge him.
Why do I have to put up with you? What a tramp. You call this a home? I work all day for this?
He marches away, leaving Josh standing alone.
Josh keeps going, whirling around. He reaches a set of st The stairs descend into darkness.
Josh squints into the dark, afraid.
Dalton? Where are you?
